pokebody.name: Flare Condition
pokebody.text: As long as Arcanine has any {R} Energy attached to it, Arcanine has no Weakness.

attack.name: Burn Out
attack.text: You may do 30 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, Arcanine is now Burned.

attack.name: Flames of Rage
attack.text: Discard a {R} Energy attached to Arcanine. This attack does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Arcanine.

attack.name: Bounce Back
attack.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Smack Attack
attack.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Bastiodon [GL].

pokebody.name: Eerie Aura
pokebody.text: Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokemon that remains Asleep between turns.

attack.name: Darkness Sleep
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, that Pokemon is now Asleep.

attack.name: Incite
attack.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Supporter cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attack.name: Giant Wave
attack.text: Floatzel [GL] can't use Giant Wave during your next turn.

pokebody.name: Rainbow Float
pokebody.text: If any basic Energy card attached to Flygon is the same type as any of your Pokemon, the Retreat Cost for those Pokemon is 0.

attack.name: Sand Wall
attack.text: Discard a Stadium card your opponent has in play. If you do, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Flygon during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Power Swing
attack.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Evolved Pokemon on your Bench.

attack.name: Sleep Inducer
attack.text: Switch the Defending Pokemon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. The new Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

attack.name: Wake-Up Slap
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon is affected by any Special Conditions, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. Then, remove all Special Conditions from the Defending Pokemon.

pokepower.name: Final Wish
pokepower.text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Jirachi would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, you may search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Detour
attack.text: If you have a Supporter card in play, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

attack.name: Swift
attack.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokemon.

pokebody.name: Boundary Aura
pokebody.text: Apply Weakness for each Pokemon (both yours and your opponent's) as x2 instead.

attack.name: Combo Throw
attack.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

attack.name: Trash Bolt
attack.text: Discard an Energy card from your hand. (If you can't discard a card from your hand, this attack does nothing.)

attack.name: Psychic Removal
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, discard all Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

attack.name: Grudge
attack.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

attack.name: Trample
attack.text: Flip a coin for each Benched Pokemon (both yours and your opponent's). If that coin flip is heads, this attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Rend
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attack.name: Long Whip
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon is affected by any Special Conditions, you may do 30 damage to any 1 Benched Pokemon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

pokebody.name: Unlucky Wind
pokebody.text: As long as Shiftry is your Active Pokemon, whenever your opponent flips a coin during his or her turn, treat it as tails.

attack.name: Conform
attack.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

attack.name: Seal Off
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon can't use any Poke-Powers or Poke-Bodies during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Return Blow
attack.text: If Aggron was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does the same amount of

attack.name: Metal Fang
attack.text: You may discard the top card of your deck. If you do, remove 2 damage counters and all Special Conditions from Aggron.

pokepower.name: Flutter Wings
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a {G} Pokemon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Beedrill is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Needle Shock
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. Ignore this effect if any of your Pokemon used Needle Shock during your last turn.

attack.name: Hand Refresh
attack.text: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws up to 4 cards. (You draw your cards first.)

attack.name: Payback
attack.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 10 damage plus 50 more damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

attack.name: Body Slam
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attack.name: Hypnosis
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

attack.name: Psywave
attack.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

pokepower.name: Undevelop
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may devolve Flareon and put Flareon into your hand. This

attack.name: Evolving Flare
attack.text: If Flareon evolved from Eevee during this turn, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

attack.name: Chop Up
Feint
attack.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

pokebody.name: Sticky Hold
pokebody.text: If Gastrodon East Sea is switched or retreats to your Bench, move as many Energy cards attached to Gastrodon East Sea as you like to the new Active Pokemon.

attack.name: Calling Wave
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Gastrodon and put them onto your Bench as Basic Pokemon. Put 2 damage counters on each of them. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Muddy Bomb
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon and 10 damage to each of your opponent's other Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Raging Sea
attack.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokemon that has any damage counters on it.

attack.name: Rage
attack.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Golem [E4].

attack.name: Double-edge
attack.text: Golem [E4] does 60 damage to itself.

attack.name: Focus Energy
attack.text: During your next turn, Heracross [E4]'s Megahorn attack's base damage is 100.

attack.name: Megahorn
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

pokebody.name: Sand Cover
pokebody.text: As long as Hippowdon is your Active Pokemon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokemon LV.x between turns.

attack.name: Save Sand
attack.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Hippowdon. Before doing damage, you may search your discard pile for a {F} Energy card and attach it to Hippowdon.

attack.name: Groundquake
attack.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokemon that isn't an Evolved Pokemon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

pokepower.name: Undevelop
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may devolve Jolteon and put Jolteon into your hand. This power can't be used if Jolteon is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Quick Attack
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attack.name: Evolving Thunder
attack.text: If Jolteon evolved from Eevee during this turn, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

pokebody.name: Icy Aura
pokebody.text: As long as Mamoswine [GL] is your Active Pokemon, put 1 damage counter on each Active Pokemon (excluding {W} Pokemon) (both yours and your opponent's) between turns.

attack.name: Avalanche
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Magic Heal
attack.text: Flip 3 coins. Remove a number of damage counters equal to the number of heads from your Pokemon in any way you like.

attack.name: Barrier Attack
attack.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Mr.Mime [E4] by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

pokebody.name: Territoriality
pokebody.text: If your Active Pokemon is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokemon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokemon. You can't put more than 2 damage counters in this way.

attack.name: Fling Away
attack.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, this attack's base damage is 30 instead of 60 and this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Giga Horn
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

pokebody.name: Maternal Comfort
pokebody.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokemon. You can't use more than 1 Maternal Comfort Poke-Body between turns.

attack.name: Ruthless Tail
attack.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Thunder Throw
attack.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Repeat Lightning
attack.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon that has any damage counters on it.

attack.name: Double Lariat
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attack.name: Rock Tumble
attack.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attack.name: Pick and Collect
attack.text: Search your discard pile for up to 4 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attack.name: Roll Over
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, both Snorlax and the Defending Pokemon are now Asleep. If tails, Snorlax is now Asleep.

pokepower.name: Undevelop
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may devolve Vaporeon and put Vaporeon into your hand. This power can't be used if Vaporeon is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Muddy Water
attack.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Evolving Aqua
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) If Vaporeon evolved from Eevee during this turn, this attack does 60 damage instead.

pokebody.name: Royal Gain
pokebody.text: When you attach a {G} Energy card from your hand to Vespiquen [E4], remove 1 damage counter from Vespiquen [E4].

attack.name: Leaf Needle
attack.text: Flip a coin for each {G} Energy attached to Vespiquen [E4]. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

pokepower.name: Gather Ice
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play Walrein from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon, you may attach as many {W} Energy cards from your hand to Walrein as you like.

attack.name: Cold Crush
attack.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Walrein and then discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

attack.name: Skill Dive
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Whirlwind
attack.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Recover
attack.text: Discard a {P} Energy attached to Alakazam [E4] and remove 4 damage counters from Alakazam [E4].

attack.name: Mysterious Beam
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

attack.name: Reckless Bomb
attack.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Electrode [G] does 100 damage to itself.

attack.name: Reflect Energy
attack.text: Move an Energy card attached to Electrode [G] to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Confuse Ray
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

attack.name: Attack and Hide
attack.text: Put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. You may shuffle Gengar [GL] and all cards attached to it back into your deck.

pokebody.name: Frost Wind
pokebody.text: As long as Glaceon is your Active Pokemon, any damage done to your Pokemon by your opponent's attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Ice Blade
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Ice Bind
attack.text: If your opponent doesn't discard a card from his or her hand, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

pokebody.name: Sand Armor
pokebody.text: If Hippowdon [E4] has any {F} Energy attached to it, any damage done to Hippowdon [E4] by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Bite and Crush
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attack.name: Split Bomb
attack.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Heavy Metal
attack.text: Flip a coin for each {M} Energy attached to Lairon. This attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attack.name: Granite Head
attack.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Lairon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

pokebody.name: Energy Refresh
pokebody.text: As long as Leafeon is your Active Pokemon, whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of

attack.name: Plus Energy
attack.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokemon.

attack.name: Soothing Scent
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

attack.name: Cross-Cut
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon is an Evolved Pokemon, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attack.name: Brush Off
attack.text: Put the Defending Pokemon and all cards attached to it on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward. (If your opponent doesn't have any Benched Pokemon, this attack does nothing.)

attack.name: Pickup Power
attack.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

attack.name: Crushing Blow
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

pokebody.name: Energy Shark
pokebody.text: If Sharpedo is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Sharpedo is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Attacking Pokemon.

attack.name: Crunch
attack.text: If an attack does damage to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 40 more damage to that Pokemon until the end of your next turn.

pokepower.name: Aqua Recycle
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a {W} Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. This power can't be used if Starmie is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Synchro Gain
attack.text: If Starmie and the Defending Pokemon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, remove 4 damage counters from Starmie.

attack.name: Powerful Spin
attack.text: Starmie can't attack during your next turn.

attack.name: Mend
attack.text: Search your discard pile for a {M} Energy card and attach it to Steelix [GL]. If you do, remove 1 damage counter from Steelix [GL].

attack.name: Squeeze
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attack.name: Fly
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Tropius during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Blessed Fruit
attack.text: Remove all damage counters from 1 of your Benched {G} Pokemon.

attack.name: Energy Typhoon
attack.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards in your opponent's discard pile. Then, put those Energy cards on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

attack.name: Quick Attack
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attack.name: Sleep Pulse
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

attack.name: Earthquake
attack.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Collect
attack.text: Draw 2 cards.

attack.name: Primal Breath
attack.text: Your opponent can't play any Pokemon from his or her hand to evolve or to Level-Up the Defending Pokemon during his or her next turn.

attack.name: Tail Code
attack.text: Move an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon to another of your opponent's Pokemon.

attack.name: Snap Attack
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon has any Energy cards attached to it, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 60.

attack.name: Iron Head
attack.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attack.name: Scary Face
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't attack or retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Whirlpool
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

attack.name: Signs of Evolution
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards that evolve from Eevee, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Bounce
attack.text: Switch Eevee with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Fire Tail Slap
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a {R} Energy attached to Flareon [E4].

attack.name: Shell Scatter
attack.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Forretress [G] can't use Shell Scatter during your next turn.

attack.name: Bomb Risk
attack.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokemon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Flip a coin. If tails, Forretress [G] does 80 damage to itself.

attack.name: Loaded Needle
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

attack.name: Stoke
attack.text: Search your deck for a {R} Energy card and attach it to Growlithe. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Take Down
attack.text: Growlithe does 10 damage to itself.

attack.name: Push Down
attack.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Endeavor
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attack.name: Corner
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Fire Fang
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

pokebody.name: Exoskeleton
pokebody.text: Any damage done to Kakuna by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Dangerous Evolution
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for an Evolution card that evolves from Kakuna and put it onto Kakuna. (This counts as evolving Kakuna.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

pokebody.name: Colorful Body
pokebody.text: Kecleon's type is {G}{R}{W}{L}{P}{F}{D}{M}{C}.

attack.name: Triple Smash
attack.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attack.name: Offensive Gas
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attack.name: Gas Bomb
attack.text: Koffing does 30 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

pokepower.name: Baby Evolution
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Snorlax from your hand onto Munchlax (this counts as evolving Munchlax) and remove all damage counters from Munchlax.

attack.name: Rest
attack.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 6 damage counters from Munchlax. Munchlax is now Asleep.

pokepower.name: Baby Evolution
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Snorlax from your hand onto Munchlax (this counts as evolving Munchlax) and remove all damage counters from Munchlax.

attack.name: Errand-Running
attack.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Offer Help
attack.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Leer
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Horn Hazard
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attack.name: Jump Tackle
attack.text: Nidorina does 10 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

attack.name: Stress Poison
attack.text: If Nidorina has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

attack.name: Toxic
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokemon between turns.

attack.name: Frustration
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Blind
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attack.name: Feint Attack
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokemon.

pokebody.name: Submerge
pokebody.text: As long as Quagsire [GL] is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Quagsire [GL] by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attack.name: Punch and Run
attack.text: You may switch Quagsire [GL] with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Find Ice
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 {W} Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Sheer Cold
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Harden
attack.text: During your opponent's next turn, if Seedot would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Seedot if that damage is 40 or less.

attack.name: Astonish
attack.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attack.name: Ripple
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokemon.

attack.name: Brine
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Healing Sea
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. Choose 1 of your Pokemon. For each heads, remove 1 damage counter from that Pokemon.

pokebody.name: Bad Sleeping Habits
pokebody.text: As long as Snorlax is Asleep, your opponent's Active Pokemon can't retreat.

attack.name: Toss and Turn
attack.text: If Snorlax is Asleep, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage. (This attack can be used even if Snorlax is Asleep.)

attack.name: Heavy Press
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage. If tails, Snorlax is now Asleep.

attack.name: Powder Snow
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

attack.name: Cosmic Draw
attack.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokemon in play, draw 3 cards.

attack.name: Swift
attack.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokemon.

pokepower.name: Gather Sand
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Trapinch is your Active Pokemon, you may search your discard pile for a basic {F} Energy card and attach it to Trapinch.

attack.name: Grind
attack.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Trapinch.

pokebody.name: Overgrow
pokebody.text: As long as Turtwig [GL]'s remaining HP is 60 or less, each of Turtwig [GL]'s attacks does 30 more damage to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Giga Drain
attack.text: After your attack, remove from Turtwig [GL] the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokemon.

attack.name: Rescue String
attack.text: Search your discard pile for up to 5 Pokemon, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck.

attack.name: Needling Sting
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

pokebody.name: Camouflage Gas
pokebody.text: If Weezing is Confused and is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take a Prize card.

attack.name: Damage Breakdown
attack.text: Count the number of damage counters on Weezing. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokemon and Weezing is now Confused.

attack.name: Smog
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

supporter.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokmon. When your turn ends, discard this card. Search your discard pile for up to 2 in any combination of Pokmon SP and basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokmon. When your turn ends, discard this card. Choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. Search your deck for a Pokmon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. (If this is the only card in your hand, you can't play this card.)
You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokmon. When your turn ends, discard this card. Remove 5 damage counters from 1 of your Pokmon SP

You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokmon. When your turn ends, discard this card. Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokmon SP

You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokmon. When your turn ends, discard this card. Move as many Energy cards attached to 1 of your Pokmon as you like to another of your Pokmon.

stadium.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card. Once during each players turn, if that players Bench isnt full, the player may flip a coin. If heads, that player searches his or her deck for a Basic Pokmon and puts it onto his or her Bench. If the player does, he or she may search his or her deck for a Pokmon Tool card and attach it to that Pokmon. If that player searched his or her deck, the player shuffles his or her deck afterward.

This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card. Any damage done by attacks from {L} Pokmon (both yours and your opponent's) to the Defending Pokmon isn't affected by Resistance. Each {L} Pokmon in play (both yours and your opponent's) has no Weakness.

card.uniqueName: Team Galactic's Invention G-107 Technical Machine [G]
card.name: Team Galactic's Invention G-107 Technical Machine [G]

trainer.text: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokmon SP in play. That Pokmon may use this card's attack instead of its own. When the Pokmon this card is attached to is no longer a Pokmon SP, discard this card. CCC Damage Porter Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokmon. This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on the Pokmon this card is attached to to that Pokmon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokmon.)

card.uniqueName: Team Galactic's Invention G-109 SP Radar
card.name: Team Galactic's Invention G-109 SP Radar

trainer.text: opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. (If this is the only card in your hand, you can't play this card.)

supporter.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokmon. When your turn ends, discard this card. Look at the 4 cards from the bottom of your deck. Choose any 2 cards you find there and put them into your hand. Put the remaining cards back on the bottom of your deck in any order.

You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokmon. When your turn ends, discard this card. You may discard a card from your hand. Then, draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. (If you can't draw any cards, you can't play this card.)

energy.text: If the Pokmon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokmon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokmon that Darkness Energy is attached to isn't {D}. Darkness Energy provides {D} Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

Damage done by attacks to the Pokmon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokmon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't {M}. Metal Energy provides {M} Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

SP Energy provides {C} Energy. If the Pokmon SP Energy is attached to is a Pokmon SP, SP Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Doesnt count as a basic Energy card.)
Upper Energy provides {C} Energy. If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent and this card is attached to a Pokmon (excluding Pokmon LV.X), Upper Energy provides {C}{C} Energy.

attack.name: Mind Shock
attack.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attack.name: Energy Cyclone
attack.text: Choose as many Energy cards from your hand as you like and show them to your opponent. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards you chose. Put those Energy cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Extreme Attack
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon LV.x. This attack does 150 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Aimed Cut
attack.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokemon.

attack.name: Double Shoot
attack.text: Discard 2 {F} Energy attached to Hippowdon and choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. This attack does 40 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Fire Spin
attack.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Infernape [E4].

attack.name: Flash Impact
attack.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokemon, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

attack.name: Darkness Magic
attack.text: Count the number of cards in your hand. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokemon. You can't put more than 8 damage counters in this way.

attack.name: Exercise
attack.text: You may discard as many Energy cards as you like from your hand. If you do, remove that many damage counters from Snorlax.

attack.name: Thunder Jolt
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

attack.name: Thundershock
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attack.name: Fly
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Flying Pikachu during your opponent's next turn.

pokepower.name: Fan Shift
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Fan Rotom's type is {C} until the end of your turn.

attack.name: Spin Storm
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent returns the Defending Pokemon and all cards attached to it to his or her hand.

attack.name: Air Slash
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to Fan Rotom.

pokepower.name: Frost Shift
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Frost Rotom's type is {W} until the end of your turn.

attack.name: Hail
attack.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Crushing Ice
attack.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each {C} Energy in the Defending Pokemon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).

pokepower.name: Heat Shift
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Heat Rotom's type is {R} until the end of your turn.

attack.name: Warm Up
attack.text: Search your deck for a {R} Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokemon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Heat Burn
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

pokepower.name: Mow Shift
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Mow Rotom's type is {G} until the end of your turn.

attack.name: Mow Down
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to each of your opponent's Pokemon.

pokepower.name: Wash Shift
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Wash Rotom's type is {W} until the end of your turn.

attack.name: Cleanse Away
attack.text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Drain Wash
attack.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

supporter.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokmon. When your turn ends, put this card into your hand instead of discarding it. Search your deck for any Rotom and switch it with any Rotom you have in play. Any cards attached to Rotom and damage counters on it are now on the new Pokmon. (Remove all Special Conditions and effects from Rotom.) Put Rotom on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.
